data.title: Siamese crocodile hatchlings a ‘promising sign’ in Cambodia, but greater protection needed - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Conservationists say they’re upbeat about the revival of Siamese crocodile populations, following the discovery that 60 of the critically endangered reptiles recently hatched from five nests in Cambodia.

data.title: QR payments expand in Thailand, Malaysia and Cambodia - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cross-border links and tourist services add to region's growing digital money usage.

data.title: Cambodia's Angkor Wat named most photogenic Unesco World Heritage site in Asia - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Manet said on Sept 15 that Cambodia’s famed religious and archaeological site Angkor Wat has been named the most photogenic Unesco World Heritage site in Asia by Times Travel. The prime minister announced this in a text posted on his official Telegram channel, with a list by Times Travel of the […]

data.description: ​​South Korea, US, Japan align on response to NK escalating provocations​

data.title: Green bonds, red flags: Cambodia’s microfinance crisis deepens amid sustainability push - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Microfinance institutions in Cambodia, accused of predatory lending, are pivoting to green bonds while borrowers, burdened by debt and climate impacts, struggle to survive.

data.title: ​Korea to pump in US$6.5 bn in 2025 to contend in global chip race​
data.description: ​​Korea to pump in US$6.5 bn in 2025 to contend in global chip race​

data.title: In Cambodia, Indigenous villagers lose forest & land amid carbon offset project - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: A 3,348-hectare (8,273-acre) protected forest established by a carbon credit project in Cambodia and encompassing the customary lands of several Indigenous Bunong communities has been destroyed largely by outsiders, while Indigenous community patrollers say they lack adequate law enforcement support from the REDD+ project.

data.title: Thai and Vietnamese tourists make up over half of foreign arrivals in Cambodia - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Nearly two million Thai and Vietnamese tourists visited Cambodia in the first seven months of 2024, a rise of over 20% compared to the same period in 2023.

data.title: Little-known “FIRM 614” confirmed as only licensed importer of gaming equipment into Cambodia as government tightens regulations - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The operators of casinos in Cambodia will have until the end of this year to register all gaming equipment on their properties or face having it removed under new regulations governing the supply, import and operation of such equipment across the country. However, questions still remain over the process going forward, and how suppliers will […]

data.title: NagaCorp-commissioned review finds Cambodia’s main short-term risks are economic, not political - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: An independent review of investment risks found that Cambodia’s biggest risks in 2024 are economic rather than political.

data.title: Cambodia’s Funan Techo Canal project: A catalog of worries (analysis) - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia plans to build a 180-km (110-mi) canal from its capital to its coast on the Gulf of Thailand, a $1.7 billion project aimed at reducing its dependence on moving cargo through ports in neighboring Vietnam.

data.title: Cambodia’s Young Environmental Activists Pay a Heavy Price - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: It’s risky to try to protect the environment in authoritarian Cambodia.

data.title: Alleged iCon Group victims emerge in Laos, Cambodia, Myanmar, Japan - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Hundreds of victims of the alleged pyramid-scheme operator iCon Group have emerged in Laos, Myanmar, Cambodia and Japan.

data.title: Dozen Japanese suspects deported from Cambodia as ‘special fraud’ cases surge - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Local authorities last week transferred twelve Japanese men believed to be members of a crime ring back to Japan, where they were accused of fraud.

data.title: Cambodia’s largest mangrove forest is ‘teeming with life,’ biodiversity survey finds - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: A survey of biodiversity in Cambodia’s Pream Krasop Wildlife Sanctuary and Koh Kapik Ramsar site identified more than 700 unique species.

data.title: ​What makes South Korea a great partner of ASEAN?​
data.description: ​​What makes South Korea a great partner of ASEAN?​

data.title: Baby trafficking syndicates in Cambodia recruiting Filipinos - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodian police have rescued 20 Filipino women who were allegedly trafficked into the country to be used as surrogate mothers in a baby trafficking ring.

data.title: Cambodia welcomes the Metropolitan Museum’s repatriation of statues looted over decades of turmoil - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The return to Cambodia this week of 14 sculptures that had been looted from the country during a period of war and unrest is like welcoming home the souls of ancestors, Cambodia’s culture minister said Thursday.
